# h3o

[h3o](https://github.com/extendr/h3o) is a lightweight R package for
interacting with [Uber’s H3 Geospatial Indexing
system](https://github.com/uber/h3). The R package uses
[extendr](https://extendr.rs/) to wrap the eponymous [h3o Rust
crate](https://crates.io/crates/h3o), which offers a pure Rust
implementation of H3, so no linking to Uber’s H3 C library. The package
is also intended to work with the
[`{sf}`](https://github.com/r-spatial/sf) package for geometric
operations and as a bonus represents the H3 class as
[`{vctrs}`](https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs), so they work seamlessly
within a tidyverse workflow.

## Installation

You can install the release version of
[h3o](https://github.com/extendr/h3o) from CRAN with:

``` r
install.packages("h3o")
```

Or you can install the development version from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("extendr/h3o")
```

## Example

H3 vectors can be created from `POINT` geometry columns (`sfc` objects)
defined by sf.

``` r
library(h3o)
library(dplyr)
library(sf)
library(tibble)

xy <- data.frame(
  x = runif(100, -5, 10),
  y = runif(100, 40, 50)
)

pnts <- st_as_sf(
  xy,
  coords = c("x", "y"),
  crs = 4326
)

pnts |> mutate(h3 = h3_from_points(geometry, 5))
#> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 1 field
#> Geometry type: POINT
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: -4.901752 ymin: 40.11472 xmax: 9.734677 ymax: 49.89308
#> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
#> First 10 features:
#>                       geometry              h3
#> 1     POINT (5.487647 47.2154) 851f82d3fffffff
#> 2    POINT (9.272557 47.89645) 851f8e97fffffff
#> 3     POINT (5.800661 49.6823) 851fa3dbfffffff
#> 4  POINT (-0.2583714 48.46233) 851861cffffffff
#> 5   POINT (-3.800555 49.27424) 85187567fffffff
#> 6    POINT (1.966951 45.20073) 851869a7fffffff
#> 7     POINT (4.91168 47.95131) 851f86d7fffffff
#> 8   POINT (-3.470888 48.00653) 85184457fffffff
#> 9     POINT (6.61529 45.55649) 851f9e87fffffff
#> 10   POINT (7.132062 41.02949) 85394d6bfffffff
```

H3 vectors also have an
[`st_as_sfc()`](https://r-spatial.github.io/sf/reference/st_as_sfc.html)
method which allows conversion of H3 cell indexes into sf `POLYGON`s.

``` r
# replace geometry
h3_cells <- pnts |>
  mutate(
    h3 = h3_from_points(geometry, 4),
    geometry = st_as_sfc(h3)
  )

# plot the hexagons
plot(st_geometry(h3_cells))
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-1-1.png)

H3 cell centroids can be returned using
[`h3_to_points()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md). If
`sf` is avilable, the results will be returned as an `sfc` (sf column)
object. Otherwise it will return a list of `sfg` (sf geometries).

``` r
# fetch h3 column
h3s <- h3_cells[["h3"]]

# get there centers
h3_centers <- h3_to_points(h3s)

# plot the hexagons with the centers
plot(st_geometry(h3_cells))
plot(h3_centers, pch = 16, add = TRUE, col = "black")
```

![](reference/figures/README-unnamed-chunk-2-1.png)

`H3Edge` vectors representing the boundaries of H3 cells can be created
with [`h3_edges()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md),
[`h3_shared_edge_pairwise()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md),
and
[`h3_shared_edge_sparse()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md).

``` r
cell_edges <- h3_edges(h3s[1:3])
cell_edges
#> [[1]]
#> <H3Edge[6]>
#> [1] 1141f867ffffffff 1241f867ffffffff 1341f867ffffffff 1441f867ffffffff
#> [5] 1541f867ffffffff 1641f867ffffffff
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> <H3Edge[6]>
#> [1] 1141f8e9ffffffff 1241f8e9ffffffff 1341f8e9ffffffff 1441f8e9ffffffff
#> [5] 1541f8e9ffffffff 1641f8e9ffffffff
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> <H3Edge[6]>
#> [1] 1141fa3dffffffff 1241fa3dffffffff 1341fa3dffffffff 1441fa3dffffffff
#> [5] 1541fa3dffffffff 1641fa3dffffffff
```

We’ve created a list of each cell’s edges. We can flatten them using
[`flatten_edges()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md).

``` r
cell_edges <- flatten_edges(cell_edges)
cell_edges
#> <H3Edge[18]>
#>  [1] 1141f867ffffffff 1241f867ffffffff 1341f867ffffffff 1441f867ffffffff
#>  [5] 1541f867ffffffff 1641f867ffffffff 1141f8e9ffffffff 1241f8e9ffffffff
#>  [9] 1341f8e9ffffffff 1441f8e9ffffffff 1541f8e9ffffffff 1641f8e9ffffffff
#> [13] 1141fa3dffffffff 1241fa3dffffffff 1341fa3dffffffff 1441fa3dffffffff
#> [17] 1541fa3dffffffff 1641fa3dffffffff
```

These can be cast to sfc objects using
[`st_as_sfc()`](https://r-spatial.github.io/sf/reference/st_as_sfc.html).

``` r
st_as_sfc(cell_edges)
#> Geometry set for 18 features 
#> Geometry type: LINESTRING
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: 5.219 ymin: 47.20471 xmax: 9.570488 ymax: 49.98739
#> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
#> First 5 geometries:
#> LINESTRING (5.787027 47.28957, 5.862476 47.51303)
#> LINESTRING (5.219 47.34282, 5.465773 47.20471)
#> LINESTRING (5.465773 47.20471, 5.787027 47.28957)
#> LINESTRING (5.614748 47.65143, 5.292523 47.56608)
#> LINESTRING (5.862476 47.51303, 5.614748 47.65143)
```

Additionally, you can get the vertexes of H3 cell indexes using
[`h3_to_vertexes()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
which returns an `sfc_MULTIPOINT`.

``` r
h3_to_vertexes(h3s)
#> Geometry set for 100 features 
#> Geometry type: MULTIPOINT
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: -5.510812 ymin: 39.92916 xmax: 9.96768 ymax: 50.21936
#> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
#> First 5 geometries:
#> MULTIPOINT ((5.292523 47.56608), (5.219 47.3428...
#> MULTIPOINT ((8.98843 47.87044), (8.901831 47.64...
#> MULTIPOINT ((5.79925 49.90325), (5.721519 49.68...
#> MULTIPOINT ((-0.1887568 48.77929), (-0.5028574 ...
#> MULTIPOINT ((-3.697215 49.31703), (-4.01933 49....
```

## Bench marks

Since h3o is written in Rust, it is very fast.

### Creating polygons

``` r
h3_strs <- as.character(h3s)
bench::mark(
  h3o = st_as_sfc(h3s),
  h3jsr = h3jsr::cell_to_polygon(h3_strs)
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 h3o         441.5µs  476.6µs     1982.    9.85KB     14.6
#> 2 h3jsr        8.16ms   8.62ms      113.    2.67MB     93.0
```

### Converting polygons to H3 cells:

``` r
nc <- st_read(system.file("gpkg/nc.gpkg", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE) |>
  st_transform(4326) |>
  st_geometry()

bench::mark(
  h3o = sfc_to_cells(nc, 5, "centroid"),
  h3jsr = h3jsr::polygon_to_cells(nc, 5),
  check = FALSE
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 h3o          4.88ms   5.19ms     190.     22.3KB    11.2 
#> 2 h3jsr       27.85ms  29.83ms      32.8   753.9KB     2.05
```

### Converting points to cells

``` r
bench::mark(
  h3o = h3_from_points(pnts$geometry, 3),
  h3jsr = h3jsr::point_to_cell(pnts$geometry, 3),
  check = FALSE
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 h3o         103.2µs  120.4µs     7358.      848B    11.4 
#> 2 h3jsr        2.69ms   3.24ms      303.     989KB     8.67
```

### Retrieve edges

``` r
bench::mark(
  h3o = h3_edges(h3s),
  h3jsr = h3jsr::get_udedges(h3_strs),
  check = FALSE
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 h3o         358.5µs  514.2µs     1649.      848B     13.1
#> 2 h3jsr         1.6ms   2.47ms      408.    67.9KB     18.4
```

### Get origins and destinations from edges.

``` r
# get edges for a single location
eds <- h3_edges(h3s[1])[[1]]
# strings for h3jsr
eds_str <- as.character(eds)

bench::mark(
  h3o = h3_edge_cells(eds),
  h3jsr = h3jsr::get_udends(eds_str),
  check = FALSE
)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 h3o          14.6µs   20.7µs    44330.    7.86KB     13.3
#> 2 h3jsr       622.3µs  701.3µs     1311.   19.82KB     15.6
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`h3_from_xy()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`h3_from_points()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`h3_from_strings()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`h3_to_points()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`h3_to_vertexes()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`as.character(`*`<H3>`*`)`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`flatten_h3()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md)
  [`is_h3()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/H3.md) : Create H3
  Index
- [`compact_cells()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/compact_cells.md)
  [`uncompact_cells()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/compact_cells.md)
  : Compact H3 Cells
- [`h3_edges()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_shared_edge_sparse()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_shared_edge_pairwise()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`is_edge()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`is_valid_edge()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_edges_from_strings()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`flatten_edges()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_edge_cells()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_edge_origin()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`h3_edge_destination()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  [`as.character(`*`<H3Edge>`*`)`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/edges.md)
  : H3 Edges
- [`grid_disk()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_ring()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_distances()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_path_cells()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_path_cells_size()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_distance()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md)
  [`grid_local_ij()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/grid.md) :
  Grid Traversal
- [`get_parents()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  [`get_children()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  [`get_children_count()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  [`get_children_center()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  [`get_children_position()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  [`get_children_at()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/hierarchy.md)
  : Hierarchical H3 Grid Functions
- [`h3_resolution()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  [`h3_base_cell()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  [`is_valid_h3()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  [`is_res_class_iii()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  [`is_pentagon()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  [`get_face_count()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/inspection.md)
  : H3 Inspection Functions
- [`is_nb_pairwise()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/is_nb.md)
  [`is_nb_sparse()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/is_nb.md) :
  H3 index neighbors
- [`sfc_to_cells()`](https://extendr.github.io/h3o/reference/sfc_to_cells.md)
  : Convert sf geometry to H3 Cells
